Recommendations for Action
Help manage the increased cost 05 production:
Recommendation #1: Extend the on-farm carbon pricinc exemption for qualifying farming fuel to marketable
natural gas and propane:
Recommendation #2: Consult on and develop a Critical Farm Input Strategy to ensure that Canadian producers
have a long-term, stable source of supply for critical farn inputs, including fertilizer, needed to produce high 1
quality agriculture and agri-food products.
Recommendation #3: Make the interest-free limit for ad vances under the Advance Payments Program (APP)
permanent beyond the 2023 program, alongside other dministrative program adjustments, to make the APP
more accessible and responsive to higher production cc sts.
Recommendation #4: Make Accelerated Capital Cost A Ilowance permanent across all classes of farm
equipment; allowing producers to depreciate 100% of th eir capital allocated to purchases of farm equipment in
the first year.
Improve risk management progran 1s and reduce regulatory and
tax burdens that restrict competiti veness.
Recommendation #5: Implement a new national grant rogram modelled after the Canada Digital Adoption
Program; that would support on-farm risk management lanning and mitigation.
Recommendation #6: Improve resilience against extren 1e weather events for all agricultural commodities,
including aquaculture, by ensuring business risk manage ment programs are responsive, predictable, and
accessible: An immediate example would be using Agric ulture and Agri-Food Canada's Drought Monitor to
trigger an AgriRecovery assessment
Recommendation #7: Increase AgriStability program co verage to 85% of the reference margin to improve
participation, predictability, and levels of support for proe ducers.
Recommendation #8: Ensure that the Pest Managemen t Regulatory Agency (PMRA) is appropriately resourced
and improves internal processes in support of timely, tra nsparent; and science-based decisions that will help
Canadian producers remain competitive in a global mark et.
Recommendation #9: Exempt farms from filing the Unde erused Housing Tax (UHT) return which requires private
corporations and partnerships (including farms) that own residential property to file a UHT return, adding an
unnecessary financial burden, even if they do not have t 0 pay the tax
Recommendation #1O: Implement measures to support a farmer's right to repair their farm machinery.
Recommendation #11: Build on the Budget 2023 extenc Jed interswitching pilot by further expanding the
distance beyond 160km and extending the pilot past the current 18-month period:
Recommendation #12: Provide financial support for the creation of a Grocery Code Adjudication Office, which
will be critical to advance the training, education, dispute ? resolution services, and oversight necessary to
implement an industry-led Grocery Industry Code of Cor Iduct.
